abstract.t: The Interactive Mail Access Protocol, Version 2bis (IMAP2bis) allows a client to access and manipulate electronic mail on a server. IMAP2bis is designed to permit manipulations of remote mailboxes as if they were local. IMAP2bis includes operations for creating, deleting, and renaming mailbox folders; checking for new mail; permanently removing messages; setting and clearing flags; RFC 822 and MIME parsing; searching; and selective fetching of message attributes, texts, and portions thereof.
